name: Kumarapala (Pala king)
content:
Kumarapala was the successor to the Pala king Ramapala in the Bengal region of the Indian subcontinent, and sixteenth ruler of the Pala line reigning for 10 years. During his reign he put down an uprising in Kamarupa by the governor  Timgyadeva, eventually replacing him with Vaidyadeva (who would rebel four years after the death of Kumarapala). He was succeeded by Gopala III.[1]

tags: All Wikipedia articles written in Indian English
raw:
This article is about Pala king. For the Solanki king, see Kumarapala (Chaulukya dynasty).


KumarapalaPredecessorRamapalaSuccessorGopala III
Kumarapala was the successor to the Pala king Ramapala in the Bengal region of the Indian subcontinent, and sixteenth ruler of the Pala line reigning for 10 years. During his reign he put down an uprising in Kamarupa by the governor  Timgyadeva, eventually replacing him with Vaidyadeva (who would rebel four years after the death of Kumarapala). He was succeeded by Gopala III.[1]

See also[edit]
List of rulers of Bengal
References[edit]


^ Bhuiyan, Muhammad Masudur Rahman (2012). "Pala Dynasty".  In Islam, Sirajul; Jamal, Ahmed A. (eds.). Banglapedia: National Encyclopedia of Bangladesh (Second ed.). Asiatic Society of Bangladesh.


Sircar, D. C. The Bhauma-Naraka or the Pala Dynasty of Brahmapala, The Comprehensive History of Assam, ed H. K. Barpujari, Guwahati, 1990.


Preceded byRamapala

 Pala Emperor1130–1140 CE

Succeeded byGopala III
